TopicTitle: STS-7/E Space Shuttle (Stock NASA Replica) Still Flies in KSP 1.4.3 - Re-enters Like the Real Thing!

Articles.Content:
Egads! You are so right Sampa! Columbia I am so sorry. My fault! CORRECTING NOW!

- - - Updated - - -

Fixed.
Thank you! It would have been wrong of me to accept the credit for Columbia's work (personal ethics)

Oh, thanks inigma! Glad to know you like it!

As for the name mistake.. Well.. It happens, right?

On a side note:

I updated the Boeing 747 and gave the shuttle the capability to separate from the 747, just as they did in the Enterprise Approach and Landing Tests for the Shuttle. Actually, it was already there when I first made it, but I updated it so that the Shuttle has separatrons to make separation easier, but it's still very failure-prone. Low speed and pitch-down angle would be the best bet, and feels very rewarding when you do manage to handle it. I also reduced part count to 396 (Okay, I have to admit, that's not a lot.) It doesn't have any visual changes, except for the landing gear being oriented further back to reduce the effects of tailstrikes. Now I'll just have to work on part count and handling.. and a good thumbnail.

The download link is still the same. Feel free to try it and offer suggestions!

Edited March 21, 2015 by Columbia
Hey pTrevsTrevs no pics yet, but I rebuilt you Galelio from scratch (but with the basics of your one) and managed to cram over 1000 m/s into it.

Hey pTrevsTrevs no pics yet, but I rebuilt you Galelio from scratch (but with the basics of your one) and managed to cram over 1000 m/s into it.

Sounds good! Post a download whenever you are ready!

My computer decided to forget a junction I made when I moved Users from an SSD C drive to another hard disk drive. Corrupted all my user profiles. I wound up backing up everything to BDRs, and then wiping out my profiles to no avail. Realized only 30 hours later I needed to simply recreate the junction. Ha! Everything restored, no backups necessary. That said, I got nothing done for KSP in the past two days because of it. That's the LAST time I install an executable claiming to be a WoT modpack without first running it in Sandboxie... thankfully it was not a virus, but most likely was a coincidence.

Edited March 22, 2015 by inigma

Sampa can I commission you to develop an STS cockpit subassembly that can detach from the orbiter and land safely in an emergency?

To start, root the STS cargo bay.

Then, start modifying the existing cockpit by adding a separator and parachutes. Offset your parts so they are all or mostly hidden and test it.

interested?

interested?

seems rather difficult... I could use a challenge! Sure!

Hey inigma,

I downloaded all the mods required for the Kanadarm, but for some reason, it won't show up. Help please!

Hey inigma,

I downloaded all the mods required for the Kanadarm, but for some reason, it won't show up. Help please!

Did you download Infernal Robotics, Tweakscale, and Kerbal Attachment System?

I just redownloaded them all tonight, and installed them with only one ModuleManager.2.5.10.dll, then loaded a vanilla KSP, downloaded a fresh STS-4, and a fresh STS Service Module from KerbalX, opened the shuttle in VAB, and went to the subassembly list, and there the STS Service Module was.

Is this what you're doing?

- - - Updated - - -

seems rather difficult... I could use a challenge! Sure!

Awesome!
btw, I JUST found your youtube channel! Subscribing!

Kerbal Attachment System is supposed to have its containers removed in the next update. I recommend updating the STS service module to have containers from the Kerbal Inventory System mod which has been created by the same person who made KAS (I think). The winches and magnets and stuff are supposed to stay, so the arm's electromagnet will be unaffected.
